elements.text: Just in case anyone is interested

text: I wondered why you didn’t use the PackageCompiler.

elements.text: I wondered why you didn’t use the PackageCompiler.

text: Great question! First, I want to keep the video as simple as possible. Second, I actually tried that already but didn’t see much improvement about startup performance. There seems to be some other factors slowing it down.

elements.text: Great question! First, I want to keep the video as simple as possible. Second, I actually tried that already but didn’t see much improvement about startup performance. There seems to be some other factors slowing it down.

text: Neat! Can’t wait to watch it

elements.text: Neat! Can’t wait to watch it

text: Would be neat to generalize this where you could point to a package, tell it what the `handler()` is and have it create and push up a Docker image, push it to your ECR repo, and create a Lambda function

elements.text: Would be neat to generalize this where you could point to a package, tell it what the
is and have it create and push up a Docker image, push it to your ECR repo, and create a Lambda function

text: Really impressive Tom, if you need any help with terraform for creating roles or additional infra in AWS just reach out

elements.text: Really impressive Tom, if you need any help with terraform for creating roles or additional infra in AWS just reach out

text: <@ULDQSHD41> I did think about making it a package but then decide to do it after this video comes out. I felt it's more important for people to understand how it works than providing a shrink-wrapped solution.

elements.text: I did think about making it a package but then decide to do it after this video comes out. I felt it's more important for people to understand how it works than providing a shrink-wrapped solution.

text: <@U01D42PK8KD> Thanks for the offer! Yeah, I agree that infrastructure as code is better. The thing is that it's usually specific to the organization. I did this as a hobby and so I don't have a real use case :slightly_smiling_face: I would be happy to see what others can do.

elements.text: Thanks for the offer! Yeah, I agree that infrastructure as code is better. The thing is that it's usually specific to the organization. I did this as a hobby and so I don't have a real use case
I would be happy to see what others can do.

text: Definitely! If you want to make this in the JuliaCloud org let me know, I can add you into it

elements.text: Definitely! If you want to make this in the JuliaCloud org let me know, I can add you into it
